title: Could we create dark matter? - Rolf Landua

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary characteristic of dark matter that makes it difficult to detect?

options.label: C
options.text: It does not interact with normal matter

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of the Large Hadron Collider (LHC)?

options.label: A
options.text: To study the properties of dark matter

options.label: B
options.text: To accelerate protons to near the speed of light

options.label: C
options.text: To create new particles by colliding protons

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: A
options.text: To confirm the existence of dark matter

options.label: B
options.text: To study the properties of dark matter

options.label: C
options.text: To create new particles that may be related to dark matter

options.label: D
options.text: To understand the underlying mechanisms of dark matter

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for the detection of dark matter particles

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It allows for the understanding of the underlying mechanisms of dark matter

title: Why a total solar eclipse is such a big deal

options.label: B
options.text: The moon's shadow falls on the Earth

options.label: C
options.text: The moon's orbit crosses the sun's plane

options.label: D
options.text: The Earth's orbit crosses the moon's plane

options.label: A
options.text: The moon's orbit is not in line with Earth's orbit

options.label: B
options.text: The moon is too close to the Earth

options.label: C
options.text: Earth's orbit is not in line with the moon's orbit

options.label: D
options.text: Sun is too far from the Earth

multiple-choice.question: What are the two points where the moon's orbit crosses the sun's plane called?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The Earth's shadow falls on the moon

options.label: C
options.text: The moon's orbit crosses the sun's plane

options.label: D
options.text: The Earth's orbit crosses the moon's plane

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Earth gets a total lunar eclipse every 18 months on average

options.label: B

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason we get annular and partial solar eclipses more often than total solar eclipses?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The moon is too close to fully block the sun

options.label: C
options.text: The sun is too far from the Earth

options.label: D
options.text: The Earth is too far from the sun

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason the moon is moving further away from Earth?

options.label: C
options.text: The moon's distance from the Earth is increasing

multiple-choice.question: What is the predicted outcome for Earth's total solar eclipses in the far future?

options.label: A
options.text: Earth will get more total solar eclipses

options.label: B
options.text: Earth will get fewer total solar eclipses

options.label: C
options.text: Earth will get annular and partial solar eclipses only

options.label: D
options.text: Earth will get no solar eclipses

options.text: To duplicate a baseball at a different location

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the final message of the transcript?

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: What Does Lead Poisoning Do To Your Brain?

options.text: It leads to memory loss and learning disabilities.

options.text: Through a tiny gap between the cells called the synapse.

options.label: C
options.text: Through a long tail called an axon at one end and branch-like structures called dendrites at the other.

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: D

title: The philosophy of Stoicism - Massimo Pigliucci

options.text: Zeno was a shipwrecked merchant who lost everything and was forced to live on the streets.

options.label: C
options.text: Zeno was a shipwrecked merchant who lost everything and became intrigued by reading about Socrates.

options.text: Zeno was a philosopher who founded Stoicism after being shipwrecked in Athens around 300 BCE.

multiple-choice.question: What is the origin of the name "Stoicism"?

options.label: A
options.text: It comes from the Stoa Poikile, the decorated public colonnade where Zeno and his disciples gathered for discussion.

options.label: B
options.text: It comes from the Greek word for "philosophy of virtue."

options.label: C
options.text: It comes from the Latin word for "school of thought."

options.label: D
options.text: It comes from the name of Zeno's mentor, Socrates.

multiple-choice.question: According to Stoicism, what is the rational structure of the universe called?

options.label: A

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: "Sometimes, even to live is an act of courage."

multiple-choice.question: What did Seneca call for in his writings?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: That individuals should cultivate virtue and self-control in themselves in order to bring positive change in others.

options.label: C
options.text: That individuals should strive for external success and wealth.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: He led the Roman Empire to victory in two major wars.

options.label: D
